It might be best just to wait for the String work to complete

timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -18,10 +18,11 @@
 
 import java.util.concurrent.Callable;
 
+
 /**
  * Allows users to "stripe" their execution in such a way that all tasks belonging to one stripe are
  * executed in-order. A stripe is somehow associated with an Object called the "stripeId".
- * It is upto the implementor of this interface to decide how to do this assocations.
+ * It is up to the implementor of this interface to decide how to do this associations.

timeline.bodyText: consider getting rid of "areSameStripe" in favor of "compareStripes(o1, o2) == 0".
timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal

timeline.bodyText: If newKey is equal to oldKey it looks like this code will do the wrong thing. The redis rename docs say: "<= 3.2.0: Before Redis 3.2.0, an error is returned if source and destination names are the same.". Perhaps the best way to handle this is to check in the renameExecutor for equal keys and return "OK".
timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal
